Joey appears startled by her presence and gestures toward her, while Chandler looks up at her with a mix of confusion and curiosity.

chunk_00001.subtitles: This is unbelievable. It's been half an hour. If this was a cartoon, you'd be looking like a ham right about now. There's the waitress. Excuse me, miss. JOEY: Hello, miss? - It's Phoebe. CHANDLER: Hi. - Hi. Okay, will that be all? Wait, wait. What are you doing here? Yeah, um, I was over there... ...then you said, "Excuse me, miss." So now I'm here. No, no. How come you're working here? Right. Because it's close to where I live, and the aprons are really cute. Can we start over? - Yeah. Okay, great. I'll be over here. - No, no, no, no.

Ross Geller sits in a chair, speaking animatedly while gesturing with his hands. Rachel Green sits nearby, listening intently with a serious expression. Monica Geller leans forward, appearing engaged in the conversation. Chandler Bing sits back in his chair with a relaxed, slightly amused expression. Joey Tribbiani sits beside Chandler, smiling. Ross Geller discusses a situation involving a monkey that is erasing messages and messing with a newspaper crossword, with Rachel Green appearing concerned and Monica Geller reacting animatedly. The conversation has a casual, slightly exasperated tone, with Ross appearing serious and Rachel reacting with concern.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
None observed.
chunk_00002.subtitles: I don't know whether he's testing me or just acting out... ...but my monkey is out of control. He keeps erasing the messages on my machine. Supposedly by accident. Oh, yeah, I've done that. And three days in a row, he got to the newspaper before I did... ...and peed all over the crossword. I've never done that.

chunk_00015.subtitles: Phoebe, can you do me a favor? Try this on to make sure it fits. Oh, my first birthday present. Oh, this is really... Oh, no, no. It's for Ursula. Hey, Phoebe, I asked you, and you said it was okay. Well, maybe now it's not okay. Okay. Well, maybe now I'm not okay with it not being okay. Okay. Knit, good woman. Knit. Knit.
